gatsby.title: The Great Gatsby
gatsby.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
gatsby.description: A portrait of the Roaring Twenties and a critique of the American Dream, centered on the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby.

mockingbird.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
mockingbird.author: Harper Lee
mockingbird.description: A compelling story of racial injustice and childhood in the Deep South through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

nineteeneightyfour.author: George Orwell
nineteeneightyfour.description: A dystopian novel exploring surveillance, totalitarianism, and the manipulation of truth in a fictional superstate.

mobydick.title: Moby-Dick
mobydick.author: Herman Melville
mobydick.description: An epic tale of revenge and obsession, as Captain Ahab hunts the elusive white whale across the oceans.

hobbit.title: The Hobbit
hobbit.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
hobbit.description: A fantasy tale following the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a reluctant hobbit who becomes an unlikely hero.
